address: Xã Kim Đồng, Huyện Tràng Định, Tỉnh Lạng Sơn
thought:
**Determining the New Administrative Unit for "Xã Kim Đồng, Huyện Tràng Định, Tỉnh Lạng Sơn"**

Okay, so I've been tasked with figuring out the new administrative designation for "Xã Kim Đồng" in Lạng Sơn.  My first step, as always, is to consult the official resolutions. I know Lạng Sơn province itself isn't being merged (per resolution 60-NQ/TW), so any changes will be within the province.

I've got a set of `other_resolutions` and the `new_wards` data to work with.  First, I scanned through the resolutions, looking for any mention of "Xã Kim Đồng" within Lạng Sơn.  Resolution 1657/NQ-UBTVQH15, concerning Cao Bằng, was immediately ruled out.  Then, 1666/NQ-UBTVQH15 for Hưng Yên was irrelevant.

Finally, I hit resolution 1672/NQ-UBTVQH15 for Lạng Sơn, which is the most promising.  Line 1 discussed merging "Chi Lăng" into a new "Thất Khê."  While it mentioned "Tràng Định," it wasn't relevant.  *But* line 3 was perfect! It explicitly states that "Kim Đồng" *along with Tân Yên and Tân Tiến* are being consolidated into a new administrative unit called "**xã Tân Tiến**". Bingo!

I immediately cross-referenced this with the `new_wards` data.  And there it was: a perfect match – "Xã Tân Tiến" in "Tỉnh Lạng Sơn".

The original address is "Xã Kim Đồng, Huyện Tràng Định, Tỉnh Lạng Sơn," so while there's no explicit district mentioned in line 3 of the resolution, the fact that "Kim Đồng" *is* in Tràng Định, the resolution is for Lạng Sơn, and the resolution explicitly details "Kim Đồng" becoming "Tân Tiến" makes me highly confident in this mapping. My conclusion: "Xã Kim Đồng" in Tràng Định is now part of "Xã Tân Tiến." This is pretty straightforward, and I feel good about this determination.

citation.header: 1672/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Lạng Sơn
citation.line: 3. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các xã Tân Yên, Kim Đồng và Tân Tiến thành xã mới có tên gọi là**xã Tân Tiến**.
